29 Apr 2018

A great source of online intermediate level Iyengar yoga classes

Although there are some great Iyengar yoga teachers in Taipei and Hualien, with my busy schedule (and a dog!) I canâ€™t always make it to a class in the morning. While I have a pretty decent home practice, I never push myself at home as much as I do with a teacher. I also tend to avoid certain types of poses altogether which means that the longer I practice at home the worse I get at things like backbends. For this reason Iâ€™ve long been looking for a good online Iyengar yoga course. Unfortunately, most of what is out there involves paying for fairly basic lessons. Certainly not worth it for me.

That is why I was so excited when I discovered Rod Stennardâ€™s Yoga Selection website. It has the usual basic and introductory courses, but after you are done with that it has dozens of intermediate and advanced classes. I took one of those this morning and it was just perfect for me.

Carrie Owerko (one of my favorite teachers when I was in NY) also has some classes online as well. Not as many as Rod, but they look great and I hope to try them someday as wellâ€¦

If you know of other great sources of intermediate level Iyengar classes online please let me know!

If that Golden State Killer story scared you, just look at what China and India are doing!

Everyone concerned about the implications of the Golden State Killer being tracked by matching DNA his relatives had posted online to an open genealogical database should take a moment to consider that â€œChinese authorities in Xinjiang are collecting DNA samples, fingerprints, iris scans, and blood types of all residents in the region between the age of 12 and 65.â€ (Read the full HRW report.) Or the fact that Indiaâ€™s poorest now have to give biometric information to receive any form of government aid.
